page.title: 01Sth Llanbrynmair Powys
page.content: This area consists of two river valleys the upper Twymyn and Cwmcalch-divided by ridge up to 450m high. It is almost exclusively sheep farming county, run on a family basis. All other employment is outside, in Newtown (15m) adjoining forestry and at Laura Ashley factories in Carno 84ms) and Newtown. About 505 of occupied houses are restored cottages used by retired 'immigrants' from England or as holiday homes. This part of Llanbrynmair community is very sparsely populated. The valley bottom is cultivated for pasture/sillage, up the slopes the rough pasture merges into moorland, and vast farms run up from the river to give a section of each kind of land.
